The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green in color. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy berries. Heptapleurum microgyne is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
